intro: Appendicula matapensis, commonly known as the Matapens Island bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the remote Matapens Islands in the Pacific. It is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that range in color from pale blue to violet, typically blooming during the dry season. The plant has adapted to its coastal habitat with succulent leaves that store water, and it produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Appendicula matapensis is listed as endangered due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Its botanical study is important for understanding island flora and conservation efforts in isolated ecosystems.
